heading: passage: eldridge cleaver, 62
subheading: an original member of the black panthers, he fled to algeria in 1968 after his arrest for his involvement in a police shootout which claimed the life of fellow panther bobby hutton. cleaver later renounced his past, joined the republican party, and became a born-again christian. he died today in a pomona, california, hospital. at the family's request, no details of his death or hospitalization were released. his prison-penned book,
author: wired staff
